description.narrative: 2.3. By 2021, justice sector policymakers, practitioners and independent human rights institutions have the capacity to fully align the Justice for Children normative framework to international standards and to effectively protect the rights of children in conflict and in contact with the law., which contributes to Access To Justice, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Protection and Justice for Children Outcome Result:By 2021, children's rights to justice and protection from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect are effectively supported by a comprehensive system of multi-sectoral prevention and response mechanisms.

mailing-address.narrative: Rr. Skenderbej Ndertesa Volkswagen kati 3 Tirana Albania

sector.narrative: CRC, CEDAW or CRPD - follow up on concluding observations
Independent national child rights institution / ombudsperson
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs
Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Albania 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.3. By 2021, justice sector policymakers, practitioners and independent human rights institutions have the capacity to fullyalign the Justice for Children normative framework to international standards and to effectively protect the rights of children inconflict and in contact with the law.

description.narrative: Albanian authorities with UNICEF advocacy and technical support advanced implementation of the normative framework of criminal justice for children which also contributed to the adherence of the right of the child to be heard in court processes despite the restrictions imposed by the pandemic. Human rights institutions used additional opportunities provided by UNICEF to advocate for and promote the realization of the rights of children, including the rights of those in conflict and contact with the law. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms (23-03-L3-03), Text

baseline.value: Score 2 (insufficient) - The right of the child to be heard/participate in criminal, civil, and administrative processes is recognised only by the Family Code

target.value: 2021:Score 3 (Fair) - Criminal Justice Legislation recognises the right of the child to be heard
